bioghist.p: William Weaver Christman, a Duanesburg, NY farmer-poet, gained nation-wide recognition with three volumes of poetry and nature essays. His son, Henry Christman wrote "Tin Horns and Calico: A decisive episode in the emergence of democracy" in 1945. The book, which has an introduction by Carl Carmer, is about the anti-rent movement in eastern New York in the mid-19th century.

scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, unpublished poems, and essays by William W. Christman, as well as pamphlets, scrapbooks, and photographs. Also includes research notes, final typescript, and galley proofs for Henry Christman's book.
